dataset_id: BigFoot GPP Surfaces for North and South American Sites, 2000-2004
title: BigFoot GPP Surfaces for North and South American Sites, 2000-2004
summary: The BigFoot project gathered Gross Primary Production (GPP) data for nine EOS Land Validation Sites located from Alaska to Brazil from 2000 to 2004.  Each site is representative of one or two distinct biomes, including the Arctic tundra; boreal evergreen needleleaf forest; temperate cropland, grassland, evergreen needleleaf forest, and deciduous broadleaf forest; desert grassland and shrubland; and tropical evergreen broadleaf forest. BigFoot was funded by NASA's Terrestrial Ecology Program.For more details on the BigFoot Project, please visit the website: http://www.fsl.orst.edu/larse/bigfoot/index.html.

citation: Zhou, Z., S.V. Ollinger, and L. Lepine. 2018. Landscape variation in canopy nitrogen and carbon assimilation in a temperate mixed forest. Oecologia. 188(2):595-606.
